The nickel electrode battery losses (in Joule) can be expressed as follows:
1
where and are the average potential of the charge and discharge processes ( cf. ESI, † for eqn (S-12) and (S-13)), and C
d the discharge capacity. Thus, the contribution of the nickel electrode battery function to the hybrid battery energy efficiency losses can be estimated by comparing Loss bat(Ni) to the energy inserted to the full cell, for the same operating conditions (a more detailed calculation is given in the ESI †).
2
where C
c = 2 C
d is the chosen charge inserted (so half of the charge converted to H 2), and is the average voltage of the full cell charge estimated at 1.6 V.
